Column Comment.0: CLASSIFICATION: SYSTEM: Identifies and describes the classification system thatis used. The UNSPSC code set is a useful and practical source of classificationinformation.
Column Comment.1: LEVEL TYPE: The type of level that has been assigned in the classification system.Typically, these levels are assigned names. In the UPSPSC code set, the parentlevel is termed the Segment, with subordinate levels family, class and commodity.
Column Comment.2: ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation used for reference type or code.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: LEVEL ORDER SEQUENCE NUMBER: The number indicating the order in thesequence of levels in the classification hierarchy, with number 1 assigned to thehighest level of the hierarchy.
Column Comment.7: LONG NAME: Common long name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema. Used in cases where the taxonomy may be derived from aPPDM table.
Column Comment.10: PPDM TABLE NAME: In cases where the contents for a level in a classificationsystem are derived from the contents of a table in PPDM (such as a table of countrynames, or the AREA module), use this to indicate which table is used. The columnSELECTION CRITERIA may be used to store the criterion for selecting a row in thattable for a classification level.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SELECTION CRITERIA: The criteria used to select objects into a layer of theclassification system. May be constructed as a SQL statement, a procedure call or aplain text description. For example, SELECT * FROM AREA WHERE AREA_TYPE =BASIN. Each return from this selection may generate a row in CLASS LEVEL.
Column Comment.13: SHORT NAME: Common short name given to reference type or code.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
